intro: Uragoga sellowiana, commonly known as the Sellow's uragoga, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Uragoga sellowiana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
